item.title: Janet add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: Janet add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "The best moments in reading are when you come across something - a thought, a feeling, a way of looking at things - which you had thought special and particular to you. And now, here it is, set down by someone else, a person you have never met, someone even who is long dead. And it is as if a hand has come out, and taken yours" -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Janet add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Janet add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "A book is a device to ignite the imagination." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Janet add a quote by Kay Ryan
item.description: "The day misspent, the love misplaced, has inside it the seed of redemption. Nothing is exempt from resurrection." -- Kay Ryan

item.title: Janet add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before! What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store. What if Christmas...perhaps...means a little bit more!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Janet add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description: "Poetry might be defined as the clear expression of mixed feelings." -- W.H. Auden
